reviews.text: We just got back from a week at the Kiahuna on Poipu Beach and we loved it. We had room 77 which is an inside, second floor ocean view condo and we would rent it again. The grounds are just bursting with every tropical plant you can imagine and immaculately maintained. The thing I really liked about the resort was that because every one is in different villas and is spread out over so many acres, the resort never felt crowded or full of people.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: There is no air conditioning in the rooms but it wasn't a problem. The building design allows for lots of natural ocean breezes to blow through.
reviews.title: Kiahuna Ocean Front Unit 202

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only two slight things for us were that our neighbours from down below complained that we were thumping around on their ceiling too much - so there's probably not enough sound proofing between the units so I'd recommend asking for an upper unit if you can.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: The other thing was that while the swimming pool area is nice, it's a bit of a hike through a crumbling tennis club to get access to it.
reviews.title: Great Poipu Beach Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we loved this place and would definitely return.
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

reviews.text: Stayed for 9 days. The beach is wonderful during low-tide and about waist deep. The beach shack rents snorkels, gives free beach towels and chairs.
reviews.title: Great beach, great condos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 2-bedroom condo had beach umbrellas, a kitchen with all items required for cooking and eating except groceries, good bath rooms, clean and comfortable beds,... The lawns and property are beautifully maintained. Poipu beach park, which has a life guard and a shielded section for kids is a two minutes away by car.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise on a great beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hint: For groceries, Sueoka store in Koloa was expensive but good and close by. We also bought a lot of stuff in Walmart and Costco.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Outrigger Kiahuna Plantation. The unit we stayed in, #235 in building 36, was beautifully finished, and included lots of incidentals & practical items that made it a very convenient place to stay, such as tupperware for leftovers & beach chairs & boogie boards. The only complaint about the property is that the pool is across the street and the pool area lacked amenities (towel service, snack bar) though that may be temporary, as the poolside restaurant was closed for renovations. The beach area and plantation gardens are postcards in the making...all beautiful. Staff were friendly & responsive. Another advantage of the Kiahuna is its location, especially if you get tired of driving everywhere - lots of tasty dining options within a short walk! Mahalo Kiahuna!
reviews.title: peaceful

reviews.text: We enjoyed our 8 nights at the Kiahuna! The beach is gorgeous and the grounds are lucious! I saw some plants that I've never seen before and so pretty! The one disapppointment was that the pool is across the street and down a path, but ultimately it wasn't an issue for us because we enjoyed swinmming in the ocean. The unit we were in was updated and nice. Be prepared to be serenaded by the roosters that begin crowing at around 3:45 am! Also, next time I would like to be a little more towards the center of the complex and away from the noise of the road. I was also worried about not having air conditioning but with the ceiling fans and the plantation windows it was never a problem. All in all, this place is very nice and I would recommend it to anyone coming to Kauai! We had a great stay even though I broke my toe on some lava rocks near the beach!!! The grounds are very nice and the staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Stayed in December 2012

reviews.text: This is the most convenient location for enjoying Poipu. The properties golf course-like lawn runs to the middle of the golden beach between the Sheraton and Marriott. Swimming, snorkeling and shore breaking surfing or boogie boarding are fun right there. Poipu Beach park with gentler swimming and snorkeling is right around the corner. The convenience of Poipu's little shopping center is right across the street. This was not important to my family, but turned out to be really nice, with great island gelato and sorbet, decent convenient market not much more expensive then the bigger markets in Koloa, and good restaurants. Keoiki's Paradise has good fish and live entertainment, although you get some noise from this in the units close to the road. But nothing really late at night. Noise factor is about what you should expect anywhere in Kauai. People waking and coming and going at odd hours because of the time change. But in general pretty quiet. Grounds with monkeypod trees, cactus and orchid gardens are pretty spectacular, so the walk to the beach from the farthest units is pretty enjoyable.
reviews.title: Prime location and property in Poipu

reviews.text: I loved our condo , opened right onto the beach.... it was clean , lovely property and great beach.
reviews.title: " What a View "
Inadequate, Rude Service
reviews.text: It was busy since we arrived during Spring Break , they seemed to have their stuff together. We had a one bedroom , kitchen & nice sitting area , but what really made this place was being on the main level , right at the beach. If you were staying somewhere else on the property it might not be so nice getting around because it is a big place.

reviews.title: Really nice resort in a great location and a great beach
reviews.text: Beach isn't big , though you have quite a few others that are within walking distance. No a/c , it just didn't make a difference since we were never really that warm with the ceiling fans and also the breeze from the beach.

Clean , great value , lovely property , great location , parking , the only downside is the pool is located across the street . We went for walks everyday , swam , went shopping and sat on our lanai which was maybe the best part of the deal.
reviews.title: Excellent location - delightful condo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for 5 nights. We enjoyed the location, right in the heart of Poipu, on a beach, and a 2-minute drive (or longish walk) to the famous Poipu beach. There is a beach on the grounds, but it is narrow and water not very calm there. Huge lawn area and free chairs (not lounge chairs, but short, squat chairs) to sit on from beach shack. Nice place to read and relax, can bring snacks/drinks, which a lot of people did. The condo itself was unexpectedly spacious, separate bedroom with big, slightly soft bed. Bathroom had good shower, separate vanity area. Big living/dining area with older rattan-type furniture. Nice big lanai overlooking garden in our case. And full kitchen, so we bought snacks and drinks for our stay. Maid service once every 4 days or so, which we liked. Can request towels if needed before that. Our unit was on 3rd floor and back by main road, farthest from beach. Can walk to Poipu shopping mall with Starbucks, etc. Short drive to Joe's on the Green, a beautiful place to breakfast - try the early bird special! Short drive to Kukui' ula mall, a newer place with nice shops and restaurants. Try happy hour at Tortilla Republic, one of the better bargains on the island. Wish the pool was in front of the ocean, but that's a minor quibble as we were usually on the go. Pool/tennis was about a 5-minute walk from unit. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Spacious grounds, condo living

reviews.text: Room was a bit older and could use some updating. Just felt a bit dated. However the lanai area was very nice with a decent garden view and was private. We found our particular unit, which was on the bottom floor to be a bit loud, both from outside noise (cars/pedestrians) and from the other guests in the units above us. I did like the grounds which were very spacious and well maintained. Beach in front of grounds was a bit narrow. Hotel was sandwiched between the Marriott and the Sheraton. No pool on property, you had to cross the main road for pool access, so we didn't bother. We got a kamaaina rate so didn't complain, but I would not stay here if I had to pay more then we paid.
reviews.title: Just OK accomodations, but nice grounds

reviews.text: My Dad and I returned to Kauai to visit friends and enjoy the island we lived on for a number of years. We chose a condominium for the convenience and comfort. We were in a ground floor unit (#323) with a garden view, which included a framed view of the ocean and the sound of the ocean. The birdsong in the mornings was wonderful! The one bedroom condo was very comfortable, including the hide-a-bed on which I slept. I would return to the property again. The unit is owned by the daughter of a composer of Hawaiian music. One of our dear friends who is a musician knows of him well and was excited by the real life connection to the islands.
reviews.title: Vacation Oasis

reviews.text: I was able to scuba dive with a nearby dive shop I have used for years. All conveniently within about 10 minutes from the condo.
reviews.title: Condo ok, the location and beach is great.

reviews.text: The grounds are extremely well maintained and the staff is very attentive to any needs or issues. Plantation Gardens restaurant and bar is a great on-site place for a drink and meal on the lanai. This is Kaua'i style living: relaxed, easy going and friendly.
reviews.title: Home away from home
